perturbation.original_text: a.       Schoolpop shall have the exclusive right to resell Cards in                   the NPO Marketplace. Notwithstanding the foregoing, Schoolpop                   shall fund from AEIS a minimum of $52,000,000 of Cards (the                   "Guaranteed Minimum") in each Contract Year in order to                   maintain the exclusive right to sell Cards in the NPO                   Marketplace.
perturbation.changed_text: a.       Schoolpop shall have the exclusive right to resell Cards in                   the NPO Marketplace. Notwithstanding the foregoing, Schoolpop                   must fund from AEIS a target of $52,000,000 of Cards (the                   "Guaranteed Minimum") in each Contract Year to                   maintain the exclusive right to sell Cards in the NPO                   Marketplace.
perturbation.explanation: The change from "shall fund" to "must fund a target of" introduces ambiguity. 'Shall fund' enforces a definitive action, while 'must fund a target of' indicates a goal rather than a binding obligation. Itâ€™s not clear whether there are penalties for not meeting the target, which creates uncertainty in enforcement.

perturbation.original_text: k.       CARDS LOST OR STOLEN IN TRANSIT IN THE INITIAL SHIPMENT FROM                   AEIS WILL BE THE RESPONSIBILITY OF AEIS. The full risk of loss                   for ordered Cards shall pass to Schoolpop immediately upon                   their delivery to Schoolpop by AEIS and AEIS shall not                   reimburse Schoolpop or Client for any delivered Card that is                   lost, stolen, misappropriated, or that otherwise disappears or                   is fraudulently or inappropriately used (together referred to                   as "Loss").
perturbation.changed_text: k.       CARDS LOST OR STOLEN IN TRANSIT IN THE INITIAL SHIPMENT FROM                   AEIS WILL BE THE RESPONSIBILITY OF AEIS. However, the risk of loss                   for ordered Cards transfers to Schoolpop upon                   their shipment by AEIS and AEIS shall not                   reimburse Schoolpop or Client for any delivered Card that is                   lost, stolen, misappropriated, or that otherwise disappears or                   is fraudulently or inappropriately used (together referred to                   as "Loss").
perturbation.explanation: The original states risk of loss transfers upon delivery, implying physical receipt. The changed version states risk transfers upon shipment, indicating AEIS only needs to dispatch the Cards. This introduces contradicting obligations regarding responsibility for Cards lost in transit, creating uncertainty in enforcement.

perturbation.original_text: d.       Schoolpop agrees to an annual review to take place forty-five                   (45 days) prior to each contract anniversary, on or about June                   15th of each contract year. This review will include, but is                   not limited to, a review of volume performance, economics of                   the products, and branding.
perturbation.changed_text: d.       Schoolpop may be subject to an annual meeting to take place forty-five                   (45 days) prior to each contract anniversary, tentatively scheduled for June                   15th of each contract year. This meeting may include a discussion of volume performance, economics of the products, and branding.
perturbation.explanation: Changing "agrees to an annual review" to "may be subject to an annual meeting" weakens the obligation from a mandatory review to a discretionary meeting. Further, replacing "This review will include" with "This meeting may include" makes the review topics optional. This introduces uncertainty whether the review is mandatory and what exactly will be reviewed, leading to potential disputes and enforcement issues.
